Posts.Title: Ouch! luvtotravel EGAL

Posts.Content: sydpen2 wrote: Just curious how long you all have taken chemo without a break.  I'm starting my 11th month straight and it is really starting to accumulate and wear me down.  Not complaining by any means if it is working.... just getting harder each day to stay upbeat.   Use to get a few good days of feeling somewhat normal and now I'm lucky to have one between treatments.  Usually when it's time to do it all over again!  As many of you I'm sure feel the same.   I know stage 4 means we could be always taking chemo.... just hope the breaks are long between. Debbie Dx 6/19/2008, Stage IV, 0/3 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How long have you done chemo? sydpen2 denisela

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2009 06:42AM sydpen2 wrote: Power Port is definitley the way to go.  It will be real tender at first stick but every one after is easier and easier and you don't really notice it.  Best thing I love is that it is under the skin and you can shower and I was swimming a few weeks later.... or should I say splashing around. It protects your veins with the treatments. My nurses are great.  They know exactly what they are doing and the Power Port is becoming quite popular.   You'll be glad you did it later!

Debbie

Posts.Title: On top of everything else now a Robbery TripleNeg SpunkyGirl

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2009 01:46PM sydpen2 wrote: My hair has been trying to grow back with this new chemo and it's grown to the point that I had my first "clean up" done on it last night!  You know the straggles around the ears and back of neck.   Actually just a good overall clean up and it looks pretty good!  Not much up there but enough that it looks like a very very very short to the head hair cut.  And the eyebrows are coming back in which tickles me the most!  I may turn around and loose it again if I change chemo again but I'm going to enjoy it while I can.

Posts.Title: Heidi Update-it isn't pretty Heidi_Ho zeeka71

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2009 10:15AM sydpen2 wrote: Currently doing Ixempra as a clinical study to see how often to take it.  I am on the every week group.  One hour treatment every week for 3 weeks and off a week.   Have my PET scan next month to see how it is doing.  I do know that there has been some very positive results with Ixempra!!  Good Good.  Side affects for me have been so much better than when I was on the Taxol.  But that may be since I am on the every week plan for one hour instead of once every 3 weeks for 3 hour treatment.  I know that my legs don't ache as much and my hair is actually growing back.  Don't know if it would if I were on the once every 3 week plan or not. I have mets to the bone and liver.  My bone was taken care of with the Taxol but the liver couldn't quite do it so switched to Ixempra.  Had 6  one hour treatments so far. Again.... good results have been shown with Ixempra!!!  Hopefully it will for you too. Debbie
Posts.Title: Treatment with Ixempra (ixabepilone) carole2 bmdaley

Posts.Content: sydpen2 wrote: Just got my PET/Cat scan results and the Ixempra is  doing its job.  Things are stable with just alittle improvement showing.  This is good news!  So continuing on with this drug and more improvement should be shown in 3 months.   Still have a ways to go but as Stephanie says....."God is Able"!!  Just keep hanging in there girls.   Live every moment. Posts.Title: Another bump in the road (Sorry it's a long one) anitach sydpen2

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2009 02:29AM sydpen2 wrote: I have been on Ixempra since December.  I'm on a study actually receiving it once a week for 3 weeks in a row and then off a week and then again.  I have had 9 treatments each an hour long and will continue the same.  Idea is to see which is more effective... once a week for an hour or once every 3 weeks for 3 hours.  I am on the every week group.  They said that next PET scan in 3 months may show significant improvement because I will have built up the amount of Ixempra in me to show more results.  So right on target so far!   Patti every one on Ixempra at the KCCC I go to has shown very positive results with Ixempra!!  That's good news.  I know what you mean about this crappy liver!  What can we call this crappy liver group??  lol And you are all right... we need to hear some positive.  Lord knows we have enough of the other to deal with and we will.   Deb
Posts.Title: Results are stable! sydpen2 lovinmomma

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2009 02:57PM sydpen2 wrote: Hi,  My Pet scan turned out very much the same last week.  The Ixempra stopped working and now they are starting me on Gemzar/Carbo.  They tell me that this new one is to be much more gentle than the Ixempra.  Ixempra was a hard hard one.   I am glad to be off of it.  We will see what this one does.

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2009 10:43AM sydpen2 wrote: Steph, You keep fighting to live!  And our prayers are being uplifted to him to give you the strength you need right now to face each thing that is happening in your life right now.  You have been inspiring to many of us and may not even realize how much.  I only know that when I get on the boards each day I always search out those who uplift me and for those who hopefully I can give alittle boost to ... to just keep fighting and hang in there one day at a time.  You have to think about you and focus on you once in a while.  Regroup and know that we are here for you.  I have only met any of you on this board.  None personally, even though it feels more personal each day.  I choose to stay away from any downers and try to focus on the positive.  Unfortunatly there are alway those who tend to bring us down.  Then my mind starts to go all over the place and I have to make myself refocus.  All in all, know that we are here and waiting to hopefully hear again from you soon. Take good care of yourself.   Hugs.... Debbie
